vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(newBondSize >= currentBondSize / self.lowerBoundDivisor, "Bond size is too low");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(uint256(newBondSize) <= uint256(currentBondSize) * self.upperBoundMultiplier, "Bond size is too high");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-nested-if
vulnerability_findings.message: Using nested is cheaper than using && multiple check combinations. There are more advantages, such as easier to read code and better coverage reports.

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in BondSize.sol:
	- pragma solidity0.5.11 (BondSize.sol#3): it allows old versions

errors: exception (RuntimeError: Source map error, unknown name(SHR) or instr_name(INVALID))
